  117: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  118: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  119: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  120: 
  121: %% suite() ->
  122: %%     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  123: 
  124: suite() ->
  125:     [{timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  126: 
  127: all() ->
  128:     [
  129:      {group, openssh},
  130:      small_interrupted_send,
  131:      interrupted_send,
  132:      exec_erlang_term,
  133:      exec_erlang_term_non_default_shell,
  134:      exec_disabled,
  135:      exec_shell_disabled,
  136:      start_shell,
  137:      new_shell_dumb_term,
  138:      new_shell_xterm_term,
  139:      trap_exit_connect,
  140:      trap_exit_daemon,
  141:      start_shell_pty,
  142:      start_shell_exec,
  143:      start_shell_exec_fun,
  144:      start_shell_exec_fun2,
  145:      start_shell_exec_fun3,
  146:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun,
  147:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun2,
  148:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun3,
  149:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data,
  150:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error,
  151:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type,
  152:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write,
  153:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced,
  154:      start_shell_sock_exec_fun,
  155:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec,
  156:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi,
  157:      encode_decode_pty_opts,
  158:      connect_sock_not_tcp,
  159:      connect2_invalid_options,
  160:      connect_invalid_port,
  161:      connect_invalid_options,
  162:      connect_invalid_timeout_0,
  163:      connect_invalid_timeout_1,
  164:      connect3_invalid_port,
  165:      connect3_invalid_options,
  166:      connect3_invalid_timeout_0,
  167:      connect3_invalid_timeout_1,
  168:      connect3_invalid_both,
  169:      connect4_invalid_two_0,
  170:      connect4_invalid_two_1,
  171:      connect4_invalid_two_2,
  172:      connect4_invalid_three,
  173:      connect_timeout,
  174:      daemon_sock_not_tcp,
  175:      gracefull_invalid_version,
  176:      gracefull_invalid_start,
  177:      gracefull_invalid_long_start,
  178:      gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl,
  179:      kex_error,
  180:      stop_listener,
  181:      no_sensitive_leak,
  182:      start_subsystem_on_closed_channel,
  183:      max_channels_option
  184:     ].
  185: groups() ->
  186:     [{openssh, [], payload() ++ ptty() ++ sock()}].
  187: 
  188: payload() ->
  189:     [simple_exec,
  190:      simple_exec_more_data,
  191:      simple_exec_sock,
  192:      simple_exec_two_socks,
  193:      small_cat,
  194:      big_cat,
  195:      send_after_exit].
  196: 
  197: ptty() ->
  198:     [ptty_alloc_default,
  199:      ptty_alloc,
  200:      ptty_alloc_pixel].
  201: 
  202: sock() ->
  203:     [connect_sock_not_passive,
  204:      daemon_sock_not_passive
  205:     ].
  206: 
  207: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  208: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  209:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(
  210:        [{ptty_supported, ssh_test_lib:ptty_supported()}
  211:         | Config]
  212:       ).
  213: 
  214: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  215:     catch ssh:stop(),
  216:     ok.
  217: 
  218: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  219: init_per_group(openssh, Config) ->
  220:     case ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []) of
  221: 	{error,econnrefused} ->
  222: 	    {skip,"No openssh daemon (econnrefused)"};
  223: 	{ok, Socket} ->
  224: 	    gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  225: 	    ssh_test_lib:openssh_sanity_check(Config)
  226:     end;
  227: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  228:     Config.
  229: 
  230: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
  231:     Config.
  232: 
  233: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  234: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  235:     ssh:stop(),
  236:     ssh:start(),
  237:     {ok, TestLogHandlerRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  238:     ssh_test_lib:verify_sanity_check(Config),
  239:     [{log_handler_ref, TestLogHandlerRef} | Config].
  240: 
  241: end_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  242:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(
  243:                      proplists:get_value(log_handler_ref, Config)),
  244:     EventCnt = length(Events),
  245:     {ok, InterestingEventCnt} = analyze_events(Events, EventCnt),
  246:     VerificationResult = verify_events(TestCase, InterestingEventCnt),
  247:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  248:     ssh:stop(),
  249:     VerificationResult.
  250: 
  251: analyze_events(_, 0) ->
  252:     {ok, 0};
  253: analyze_events(Events, EventNumber) when EventNumber > 0 ->
  254:     {ok, Cnt} = print_interesting_events(Events, 0),
  255:     case Cnt > 0 of
  256:         true ->
  257:             ct:comment("(logger stats) interesting: ~p boring: ~p",
  258:                        [Cnt, EventNumber - Cnt]);
  259:         _ ->
  260:             ct:comment("(logger stats) boring: ~p",
  261:                        [length(Events)])
  262:     end,
  263:     AllEventsSummary = lists:flatten([process_event(E) || E <- Events]),
  264:     ct:log("~nTotal logger events: ~p~nAll events:~n~s", [EventNumber, AllEventsSummary]),
  265:     {ok, Cnt}.
  266: 
  267: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  268:                         #{label := Label,
  269:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  270:                                      {Status, Properties}]}},
  271:                 level := Level}) ->
  272:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  273: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  274:                         #{label := Label,
  275:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  276:                                      {errorContext, _ErrorContext},
  277:                                      {reason, {Status, _ReasonDetails}},
  278:                                      {offender, Properties}]}},
  279:                 level := Level}) ->
  280:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  281: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  282:                         #{label := Label,
  283:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  284:                                      {errorContext, _ErrorContext},
  285:                                      {reason, Status},
  286:                                      {offender, Properties}]}},
  287:                 level := Level}) ->
  288:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  289: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  290:                         #{label := Label,
  291:                           report := [Properties, []]}},
  292:                 level := Level}) ->
  293:     {status, Status} = get_value(status, Properties),
  294:     {pid, Pid} = get_value(pid, Properties),
  295:     Id = get_value(registered_name, Properties),
  296:     {initial_call, {M, F, Args}} = get_value(initial_call, Properties),
  297:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s)~n",
  298:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  299:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label, Status, Id, M, F, Args]]);
  300: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  301:                         #{label := Label,
  302:                           name := Pid,
  303:                           reason := {Reason, _Stack = [{M, F, Args, Location} | _]}}},
  304:                 level := Level}) ->
  305:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s) ~30s~n",
  306:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  307:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label, Reason, undefined, M, F, Args, Location]]);
  308: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  309:                         #{label := Label,
  310:                          format := Format,
  311:                          args := Args}},
  312:                 meta := #{pid := Pid},
  313:                 level := Level}) ->
  314:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~150s~n",
  315:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  316:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label]] ++ [io_lib:format(Format, Args)]);
  317: process_event(E) ->
  318:     io_lib:format("~n||RAW event||~n~p~n", [E]).
  319: 
  320: format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level) ->
  321:     {pid, Pid} = get_value(pid, Properties),
  322:     Id = get_value(id, Properties),
  323:     {M, F, Args} = get_mfa_value(Properties),
  324:     RestartType = get_value(restart_type, Properties),
  325:     Significant = get_value(significant, Properties),
  326:     io_lib:format("[~30s <- ~10s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s) ~20s ~25s~n",
  327:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  328:                       E <- [Supervisor, Pid, Level, Label, Status, Id, M, F, Args,
  329:                             Significant, RestartType]]).
  330: 
  331: get_mfa_value(Properties) ->
  332:     case get_value(mfargs, Properties) of
  333:         {mfargs, MFA} ->
  334:             MFA;
  335:         false ->
  336:             {mfa, MFA} = get_value(mfa, Properties),
  337:             MFA
  338:     end.
  339: 
  340: get_value(Key, List) ->
  341:     case lists:keyfind(Key, 1, List) of
  342:         R = false ->
  343:             ct:log("Key ~p not found in~n~p", [Key, List]),
  344:             R;
  345:         R -> R
  346:     end.
  347: 
  348: print_interesting_events([], Cnt) ->
  349:     {ok, Cnt};
  350: print_interesting_events([#{level := Level} = Event | Tail], Cnt)
  351:   when Level /= info, Level /= notice ->
  352:     ct:log("------------~nInteresting event found:~n~p~n==========~n", [Event]),
  353:     print_interesting_events(Tail, Cnt + 1);
  354: print_interesting_events([_|Tail], Cnt) ->
  355:     print_interesting_events(Tail, Cnt).
  356: 
  357: verify_events(_TestCase, 0) -> ok;
  358: verify_events(no_sensitive_leak, 1) -> ok;
  359: verify_events(max_channels_option, 3) -> ok;
  360: verify_events(_TestCase, EventNumber) when EventNumber > 0->
  361:     {fail, lists:flatten(
  362:              io_lib:format("unexpected event cnt: ~s",
  363:                            [integer_to_list(EventNumber)]))}.
  364: 
  365: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  366: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  367: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  368: simple_exec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  369:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  370:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  371: 
  372: simple_exec_more_data(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  373:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  374:     %% more data received, SSH window adjust needs to be sent by client
  375:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 60000).
  376: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  377: simple_exec_sock(_Config) ->
  378:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  379:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  380:                                              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  381:                                              {user_interaction, true}
  382:                                             ]),
  383:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  384: 
  385: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  386: simple_exec_two_socks(_Config) ->
  387:     Parent = self(),
  388:     F = fun() ->
  389:                 spawn_link(
  390:                   fun() ->
  391:                           {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  392:                           {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  393:                                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  394:                                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  395:                           Parent ! {self(),do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef)}
  396:                   end)
  397:         end,
  398:     Pid1 = F(),
  399:     Pid2 = F(),
  400:     receive
  401:         {Pid1,ok} -> ok
  402:     end,
  403:     receive
  404:         {Pid2,ok} -> ok
  405:     end.
  406: 
  407: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  408: connect2_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  409:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_socket, {bad, option}).
  410: 
  411: connect3_invalid_port(_Config) ->
  412:     {error, invalid_port} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, noport, [{key, value}]).
  413: 
  414: connect3_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  415:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, 1337, bad_options).
  416: 
  417: connect3_invalid_timeout_0(_Config) ->
  418:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  419:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], short).
  420: 
  421: connect3_invalid_timeout_1(_Config) ->
  422:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  423:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], -1).
  424: 
  425: connect3_invalid_both(_Config) ->
  426:     %% The actual reason is implementation dependent.
  427:     {error, _Reason} =
  428:         ssh:connect(bogus, no_list_or_port, no_list_or_timeout).
  429: 
  430: connect_invalid_port(Config) ->
  431:     {Pid, Host, _Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  432: 
  433:     {error, invalid_port} =
  434:         ssh:connect(Host, undefined,
  435:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  436:                      {user, "foo"},
  437:                      {password, "morot"},
  438:                      {user_interaction, false},
  439:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  440:                     infinity),
  441: 
  442:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  443: 
  444: connect_invalid_timeout_0(Config) ->
  445:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  446: 
  447:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  448:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  449:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  450:                      {user, "foo"},
  451:                      {password, "morot"},
  452:                      {user_interaction, false},
  453:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  454:                    longer),
  455: 
  456:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  457: 
  458: connect_invalid_timeout_1(Config) ->
  459:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  460: 
  461:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  462:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  463:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  464:                      {user, "foo"},
  465:                      {password, "morot"},
  466:                      {user_interaction, false},
  467:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  468:                    -1),
  469: 
  470:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  471: 
  472: connect_invalid_options(Config) ->
  473:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  474: 
  475:     {error, invalid_options} =
  476:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  477:                     {user, "foo"},
  478:                     infinity),
  479: 
  480:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  481: 
  482: %% Two out three arguments incorrect.  Three possibilities.
  483: connect4_invalid_two_0(Config) ->
  484:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  485: 
  486:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  487:     {error, _} =
  488:         ssh:connect(Host, noport,
  489:                     {user, "foo"},
  490:                     infinity),
  491: 
  492:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  493: 
  494: connect4_invalid_two_1(Config) ->
  495:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  496: 
  497:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  498:     {error, _} =
  499:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  500:                     {user, "foo"},
  501:                     short),
  502: 
  503:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  504: 
  505: connect4_invalid_two_2(Config) ->
  506:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  507: 
  508:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  509:     {error, _} =
  510:         ssh:connect(Host, newport,
  511:                     [{user, "foo"}],
  512:                     -1),
  513: 
  514:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  515: 
  516: %% All three args incorrect
  517: connect4_invalid_three(Config) ->
  518:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  519: 
  520:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  521:     {error, _} =
  522:         ssh:connect(Host, teleport,
  523:                     {user, "foo"},
  524:                     fortnight),
  525: 
  526:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  527: 
  528: daemon_start(Config) ->
  529:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  530:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  531:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  532:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  533: 
  534:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  535:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  536:                                              {password, "morot"},
  537:                                              {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
  538:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir}.
  539: 
  540: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  541: connect_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  542:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  543:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  544:                                                  {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  545:                                                  {user_interaction, true}]),
  546:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  547: 
  548: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  549: connect_timeout(_Config) ->
  550:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
  551:     {ok, {_,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
  552:     {error,timeout} = ssh:connect(loopback, Port, [{connect_timeout,2000},
  553:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
  554:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true}]),
  555:     gen_tcp:close(Sl).
  556: 
  557: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  558: daemon_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  559:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  560:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  561:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  562: 
  563: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  564: connect_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  565:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  566:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  567:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  568:                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  569:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  570: 
  571: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  572: daemon_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  573:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  574:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  575:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  576: 
  577: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  578: small_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  579:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  580:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  581:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  582: 				  "cat", infinity),
  583: 
  584:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  585:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data),
  586:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  587: 
  588:     %% receive response to input
  589:     receive
  590: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, Data}} ->
  591: 	    ok
  592:     after 
  593: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  594:     end,
  595: 
  596:     %% receive close messages
  597:     receive
  598: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  599: 	    ok
  600:     after 
  601: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  602:     end,
  603:     receive
  604: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  605: 	    ok
  606:     after 
  607: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  608:     end,
  609:     receive
  610: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  611: 	    ok
  612:     after 
  613: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  614:     end.
  615: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  616: big_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  617:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  618: 							     {user_interaction, false}]),
  619:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  620:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  621: 				  "cat", infinity),
  622: 
  623:     %% build 10MB binary
  624:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,2500000)>>,
  625: 
  626:     ct:log("sending ~p byte binary~n",[size(Data)]),
  627:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 10000),
  628:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  629: 
  630:     %% collect echoed data until eof
  631:     case big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0) of
  632: 	{ok, Data} ->
  633: 	    ok;
  634: 	{ok, Other} ->
  635: 	    case size(Data) =:= size(Other) of
  636: 		true ->
  637: 		    ct:log("received and sent data are same"
  638: 			   "size but do not match~n",[]);
  639: 		false ->
  640: 		    ct:log("sent ~p but only received ~p~n",
  641: 			   [size(Data), size(Other)])
  642: 	    end,
  643: 	    ct:fail(receive_data_mismatch);
  644: 	Else ->
  645: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  646:     end,
  647: 
  648:     %% receive close messages (eof already consumed)
  649:     receive
  650: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  651: 	    ok 
  652:     after 
  653: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  654:     end,
  655:     receive
  656: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  657: 	    ok
  658:     after 
  659: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  660:     end.
  661: 
  662: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  663: send_after_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  664:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  665:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  666:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  667: 
  668:     %% Shell command "false" will exit immediately
  669:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  670: 				  "false", infinity),
  671:     receive
  672: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  673: 	    ok
  674:     after 
  675: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  676:     end,
  677:     receive
  678: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, ExitStatus}} when ExitStatus=/=0 ->
  679: 	    ok
  680:     after 
  681: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  682:     end,
  683:     receive
  684: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  685: 	    ok
  686:     after 
  687: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  688:     end,
  689:     case ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 2000) of
  690: 	{error, closed} -> ok;
  691: 	ok ->
  692: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, ok}});
  693: 	{error, timeout} ->
  694: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, {error, timeout}}});
  695: 	Else ->
  696: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  697:     end.
  698: 
  699: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  700: encode_decode_pty_opts(_Config) ->
  701:     Tags =
  702:         [vintr, vquit, verase, vkill, veof, veol, veol2, vstart, vstop, vsusp, vdsusp,
  703:          vreprint, vwerase, vlnext, vflush, vswtch, vstatus, vdiscard, ignpar, parmrk,
  704:          inpck, istrip, inlcr, igncr, icrnl, iuclc, ixon, ixany, ixoff, imaxbel, isig,
  705:          icanon, xcase, echo, echoe, echok, echonl, noflsh, tostop, iexten, echoctl,
  706:          echoke, pendin, opost, olcuc, onlcr, ocrnl, onocr, onlret, cs7, cs8, parenb,
  707:          parodd, tty_op_ispeed, tty_op_ospeed],
  708:     Opts =
  709:         lists:zip(Tags,
  710:                   lists:seq(1, length(Tags))),
  711:     
  712:     case ssh_connection:encode_pty_opts(Opts) of
  713:         Bin when is_binary(Bin) ->
  714:             case ssh_connection:decode_pty_opts(Bin) of
  715:                 Opts ->
  716:                     ok;
  717:                 Other ->
  718:                     ct:log("Expected ~p~nGot ~p~nBin = ~p",[Opts,Other,Bin]),
  719:                     ct:fail("Not the same",[])
  720:             end;
  721:         Other ->
  722:             ct:log("encode -> ~p",[Other]),
  723:             ct:fail("Encode failed",[])
  724:     end.
  725: 
  726: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  727: ptty_alloc_default(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  728:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  729:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  730:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  731:                  true -> success;
  732:                  false -> failure
  733:              end,
  734:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []),
  735:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  736: 
  737: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  738: ptty_alloc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  739:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  740:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  741:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  742:                  true -> success;
  743:                  false -> failure
  744:              end,
  745:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  746:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {width, 70}, {height, 20}]),
  747:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  748: 
  749: 
  750: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  751: ptty_alloc_pixel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  752:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  753:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  754:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  755:                  true -> success;
  756:                  false -> failure
  757:              end,
  758:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  759:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {pixel_widh, 630}, {pixel_hight, 470}]),
  760:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  761: 
  762: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  763: %%- small_interrupted_send is interrupted by ssh_echo_server which is
  764: %%  done with transferring data towards client and terminates the
  765: %%  channel (this results with {error, closed} return value from
  766: %%  ssh_connection:send on the client side)
  767: %%- interrupted_send used to be interrupted when ssh_echo_server ran
  768: %%  out of data window and closed channel
  769: %%- but with automatic window adjustment, above condition is not taking
  770: %%  place, so ssh_echo_server continues sending data until it is done
  771: %%- so ssh_connection:send returns 'ok'
  772: small_interrupted_send(Config) ->
  773:     K = 1024,
  774:     SendSize = 10 * K * K,
  775:     EchoSize = 4 * K,
  776:     do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, {error, closed}).
  777: interrupted_send(Config) ->
  778:     K = 1024,
  779:     SendSize = 10 * K * K,
  780:     EchoSize = 4 * K * K,
  781:     do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, ok).
  782: 
  783: do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, SenderResult) ->
  784:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  785:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  786:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  787:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  788:     EchoSS_spec = {ssh_echo_server, [EchoSize,[{dbg,true}]]},
  789:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  790: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  791: 					     {password, "morot"},
  792: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n",EchoSS_spec}]}]),
  793:     ct:log("~p:~p connect", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  794:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  795: 						      {user, "foo"},
  796: 						      {password, "morot"},
  797: 						      {user_interaction, false},
  798: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  799:     ct:log("~p:~p connected", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  800:     %% build big binary
  801:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,SendSize div 4)>>,
  802:     %% expect remote end to send us EchoSize back
  803:     <<ExpectedData:EchoSize/binary, _/binary>> = Data,
  804:     %% Spawn listener. Otherwise we could get a deadlock due to filled buffers
  805:     Parent = self(),
  806:     ResultPid = spawn(
  807: 		  fun() ->
  808: 			  ct:log("~p:~p open channel",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  809: 			  {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  810: 			  ct:log("~p:~p start subsystem", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  811: 			  case ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "echo_n", infinity) of
  812: 			      success ->
  813: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, ChannelId},
  814: 				  Result =
  815: 				      try collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize)
  816: 				      of
  817: 					  ExpectedData ->
  818: 					      ct:log("~p:~p got expected data",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  819: 					      ok;
  820: 					  Other ->
  821: 					      ct:log("~p:~p unexpected: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  822: 					      {fail,"unexpected result in listener"}
  823: 				      catch
  824: 					  Class:Exception ->
  825: 					      {fail, io_lib:format("Listener exception ~p:~p",[Class,Exception])}
  826: 				      end,
  827: 				  Parent ! {self(), result, Result};
  828: 			      Other ->
  829: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, error, Other}
  830: 			  end
  831: 		  end),
  832:     receive
  833: 	{ResultPid, channelId, error, Other} ->
  834: 	    ct:log("~p:~p channelId error ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  835: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  836: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  837: 	    {fail, "ssh_connection:subsystem"};
  838: 	{ResultPid, channelId, ChannelId} ->
  839: 	    ct:log("~p:~p ~p going to send ~p bytes", [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),size(Data)]),
  840: 	    SenderPid = spawn(fun() ->
  841: 				      Parent ! {self(),  ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Data, 30000)}
  842: 			      end),
  843: 	    receive
  844: 	    	{ResultPid, result, {fail, Fail}} ->
  845: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Listener failed: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Fail]),
  846: 		    {fail, Fail};
  847: 		{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  848: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  849: 		    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  850: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  851: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Check sender", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  852: 		    receive
  853: 			{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  854: 			    ct:log("~p:~p ~p - That's what we expect :)",
  855:                                    [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
  856: 			    ok;
  857: 			Msg ->
  858: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Not expected send result: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  859: 			    {fail, "Not expected msg"}
  860: 		    end;
  861: 		{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  862: 		    ct:log("~p:~p ~p - That's what we expect, "
  863:                            "but client channel handler has not reported yet",
  864:                            [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
  865: 		    receive
  866: 			{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  867: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Now got the result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  868: 			    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  869: 			    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  870: 			    ok;
  871: 			Msg ->
  872: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Got an unexpected msg ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  873: 			    {fail, "Un-expected msg"}
  874: 		    end;
  875: 		Msg ->
  876: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  877: 		    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
  878: 	    end
  879:     end.
  880: 
  881: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  882: start_shell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  883:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  884:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  885:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  886:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  887:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  888: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  889: 					     {password, "morot"},
  890: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  891: 
  892:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  893: 						      {user, "foo"},
  894: 						      {password, "morot"},
  895: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  896: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  897:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Enter command">>), % No pty alloc by erl client
  898:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
  899:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  900:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  901: 
  902: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  903: new_shell_dumb_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  904:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "dumb",
  905:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  906:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  907:                                ],
  908:                        exp_output =>
  909:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  910:                             <<"1> ">>,
  911:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n">>,
  912:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  913:                             <<"2> ">>],
  914:                        unexp_output =>
  915:                            [<<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>]},
  916:                     Config).
  917: 
  918: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  919: new_shell_xterm_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  920:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "xterm",
  921:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  922:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  923:                                ],
  924:                        exp_output =>
  925:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  926:                             <<"1> ">>,
  927:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n">>,
  928:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  929:                             <<"2> ">>,
  930:                             <<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>,
  931:                             <<"\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\e[J\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m \r\n  one_atom_please.\e[A\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b">>]},
  932:                     Config).
  933: 
  934: new_shell_helper(#{term := Term, cmds := Cmds,
  935:                    exp_output := ExpectedOutput} = Settings, Config) ->
  936:     UnexpectedOutput = maps:get(unexp_output, Settings, []),
  937:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  938:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  939:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  940:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  941:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  942: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  943: 					     {password, "morot"},
  944:                                              {subsystems, []},
  945:                                              {keepalive, true},
  946:                                              {nodelay, true},
  947:                                              {shell, fun(U, H) ->
  948:                                                              start_our_shell2(U, H)
  949:                                                      end}
  950:                                             ]),
  951:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  952: 						      {user, "foo"},
  953: 						      {password, "morot"},
  954: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  955:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  956:     success =
  957:         ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
  958:                                   [{term, Term}, {hight, 24}, {width,1023}],
  959:                                   infinity),
  960:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
  961:     [ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, C) || C <- Cmds],
  962:     GetTuple = fun(Bin) -> {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,0,Bin}} end,
  963:     Msgs = [GetTuple(B) || B <- ExpectedOutput],
  964:     expected = ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result(Msgs),
  965:     UnexpectedMsgs = [GetTuple(C) || C <- UnexpectedOutput],
  966:     flush_msgs(UnexpectedMsgs),
  967: 
  968:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  969:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  970: 
  971: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------
  972: start_shell_pty(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  973:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),

  978: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  979: 					     {password, "morot"},
  980: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  981: 
  982:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  983: 						      {user, "foo"},
  984: 						      {password, "morot"},
  985: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  986: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),

  996:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth

 1000: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1001: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1002: 					     {exec, {?MODULE,ssh_exec_echo,["foo"]}} ]),
 1003: 
 1004:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1005: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1006: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1007: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1008: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1009:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef),
 1010:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef,  "testing",  <<"echo testing\r\n">>),
 1011:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1012:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).

 1014: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1015: exec_erlang_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1016:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1017:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1018:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1019:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1020:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1021: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1022: 					     {password, "morot"}
 1023:                                             ]),
 1024: 
 1025:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1026: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1027: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1028: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1029: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1030:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef),
 1031:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef),
 1032:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1033:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1034:

 1042: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1043: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1044:                                              {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end}
 1045:                                             ]),

 1048: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1049: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1050: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1051: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}
 1052:                                                      ]),
 1053:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
 1054:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),

 1100: start_shell_exec_fun(Config) ->
 1101:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd) ->
 1102:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1103:                                                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 1104:                                           end)
 1105:                             end,
 1106:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\r\n">>, 0,
 1107:                             Config).
 1108: 
 1109: start_shell_exec_fun2(Config) ->
 1110:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User) ->
 1111:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1112:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1113:                                           end)
 1114:                             end,
 1115:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\r\n">>, 0,
 1116:                             Config).
 1117: 
 1118: start_shell_exec_fun3(Config) ->
 1119:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User, _PeerAddr) ->
 1120:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1121:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1122:                                           end)
 1123:                             end,
 1124:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\r\n">>, 0,
 1125:                             Config).
 1126: 
 1127: start_shell_exec_direct_fun(Config) ->
 1128:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s~n",[Cmd])} end},
 1129:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
 1130:                             Config).
 1131: 
 1132: start_shell_exec_direct_fun2(Config) ->
 1133:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1134:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1135:                             Config).
 1136: 
 1137: start_shell_exec_direct_fun3(Config) ->
 1138:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User,_PeerAddr) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1139:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1140:                             Config).
 1141: 
 1142: start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data(Config) ->
 1143:     N = 60000,
 1144:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 1145:     ReceiveFun =
 1146:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, _Expect, _ExpectType) ->
 1147:                 receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
 1148:                               N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1149:         end,
 1150:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct,
 1151:                              fun(_Cmd) ->
 1152:                                      {ok,
 1153:                                       [io_lib:format("testing~n",[]) ||
 1154:                                           _ <- lists:seq(1, N)]}
 1155:                              end},
 1156:                             "not_relevant", <<"not_used\n">>, 0,
 1157:                             ReceiveFun,
 1158:                             Config).
 1159: 
 1160: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error(Config) ->
 1161:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> {error, {bad}} end},
 1162:                             "testing", <<"**Error** {bad}">>, 1,
 1163:                             Config).
 1164: 
 1165: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type(Config) ->
 1166:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> very_bad end},
 1167:                             "testing", <<"**Error** Bad exec fun in server. Invalid return value: very_bad">>, 1,
 1168:                             Config).
 1169: 
 1170: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write(Config) ->
 1171:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1172:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1173:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1174:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1175:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1176: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1177: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1178: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1179: 
 1180:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1181:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1182:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1183:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1184:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1185: 
 1186:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1187: 
 1188:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1189:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\r\n">>}}),
 1190: 
 1191:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1192:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1193:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\r\n">>}}),
 1194: 
 1195:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1196:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "quit.\n", 5000),
 1197:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{1,inputs}">>}}),
 1198:     receive
 1199:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,0}} -> ok
 1200:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1201:     end,
 1202:     receive
 1203:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1204:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1205:     end,
 1206:     receive
 1207:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1208:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1209:     end,
 1210:     receive
 1211:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1212:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1213:     after 0 -> go_on
 1214:     end,
 1215:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1216: 
 1217: 
 1218: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced(Config) ->
 1219:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1220:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1221:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1222:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1223:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1224: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1225: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1226: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1227: 
 1228:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1229:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1230:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1231:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1232:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1233: 
 1234:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1235: 
 1236:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1237:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\r\n">>}}),
 1238: 
 1239:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1240:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1241:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\r\n">>}}),
 1242: 
 1243:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1244:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'Hi ", 5000),
 1245:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "there", 5000),
 1246:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'", 5000),
 1247:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, ".\n", 5000),
 1248:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,'Hi there'}\r\n">>}}),
 1249:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"3> ">>}}),
 1250:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "bad_input.\n", 5000),
 1251:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,1,<<"**Error** {bad_input,3}">>}}),
 1252:     receive
 1253:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,255}} -> ok
 1254:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1255:     end,
 1256:     receive
 1257:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1258:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1259:     end,
 1260:     receive
 1261:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1262:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1263:     end,
 1264:     receive
 1265:         X -> ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X]),
 1266:         ct:fail("remaining messages")
 1267:     after 0 -> go_on
 1268:     end,
 1269:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1270: 
 1271: 
 1272: 
 1273:     
 1274: %% A tiny read-write loop ended by a 'quit.\n'
 1275: read_write_loop(Prompt) ->
 1276:     io:format("Tiny read/write test~n", []),
 1277:     read_write_loop1(Prompt, 1).
 1278: 
 1279: read_write_loop1(Prompt, N) ->
 1280:     case io:read(lists:concat([N,Prompt])) of
 1281:         {ok, quit} ->
 1282:             {ok, {N-1, inputs}};
 1283:         {ok, bad_input} ->
 1284:             {error, {bad_input,N}};
 1285:         {ok,Inp} ->
 1286:             io:format("~p~n",[simple_eval(Inp)]),
 1287:             read_write_loop1(Prompt, N+1)
 1288:     end.
 1289:     
 1290: simple_eval(Inp) -> {simple_eval,Inp}.
 1291: 
 1292: 
 1293: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, Config) ->
 1294:     DefaultReceiveFun =
 1295:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType) ->
 1296:                 receive
 1297:                     {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}} ->
 1298:                         ok
 1299:                 after 5000 ->
 1300:                         receive
 1301:                             Other ->
 1302:                                 ct:log("Received other:~n~p~nExpected: ~p~n",
 1303:                                        [Other,
 1304:                                         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 1305:                                          {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1306:                                          %% {data, '_ChannelId', ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1307:                                 ct:fail("Unexpected response")
 1308:                         after 0 ->
 1309:                                 ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1310:                         end
 1311:                 end
 1312:         end,
 1313:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, DefaultReceiveFun, Config).
 1314: 
 1315: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, ReceiveFun, Config) ->
 1316:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1317:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1318:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1319:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1320:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1321: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1322: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1323: 					     {exec, Fun}]),
 1324: 
 1325:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1326: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1327: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1328: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1329: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1330: 
 1331:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1332:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Command, infinity),
 1333:     ReceiveFun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType),
 1334:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1335:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1336: 
 1337: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1338: %% Issue GH-8223
 1339: trap_exit_connect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1340:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1341:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1342:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1343:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1344:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1345:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
 1346:                                              {password, "morot"}]),
 1347:     %% Fake an EXIT message
 1348:     ExitMsg = {'EXIT', self(), make_ref()},
 1349:     self() ! ExitMsg,
 1350: 
 1351:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1352:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1353:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1354:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1355:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1356:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1357:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1358:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1359: 
 1360:     %% Ensure the EXIT message is still there
 1361:     receive
 1362:         ExitMsg -> ok
 1363:     after 0 ->
 1364:         ct:fail("No EXIT message")
 1365:     end.
 1366: 
 1367: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1368: %% Issue GH-8223
 1369: trap_exit_daemon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1370:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1371:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1372:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1373:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1374: 
 1375:     %% Fake an EXIT message
 1376:     ExitMsg = {'EXIT', self(), make_ref()},
 1377:     self() ! ExitMsg,
 1378: 
 1379:     {ok, DaemonRef} = ssh:daemon(0, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1380:                                      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1381:     ssh:stop_daemon(DaemonRef),
 1382: 
 1383:     %% Ensure the EXIT message is still there
 1384:     receive
 1385:         ExitMsg -> ok
 1386:     after 0 ->
 1387:         ct:fail("No EXIT message")
 1388:     end.
 1389: 
 1390: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1391: start_shell_sock_exec_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1392:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1393:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1394:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1395:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1396:     {Pid, HostD, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1397:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1398:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1399:                                               {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1400:     Host = ssh_test_lib:ntoa(ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(HostD)),
 1401: 
 1402:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
 1403:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1404:                                             {save_accepted_host, false},
 1405: 					    {user, "foo"},
 1406: 					    {password, "morot"},
 1407: 					    {user_interaction, true},
 1408: 					    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1409: 
 1410:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1411: 
 1412:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1413: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1414: 
 1415:     receive
 1416: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\r\n">>}} ->
 1417: 	    ok
 1418:     after 5000 ->
 1419: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1420:     end,
 1421: 
 1422:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1423:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1424: 
 1425: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1426: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec(Config) ->
 1427:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1428:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1429:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1430:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1431: 
 1432:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1433:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1434:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1435: 
 1436:     %% A server tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1437:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1438: 		       {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1439: 		       {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1440: 						    {user_dir, UserDir},
 1441: 						    {password, "morot"},
 1442: 						    {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}])
 1443: 	       end),
 1444: 
 1445:     %% The client accepts the tcp connection from the server and ssh-connects to it
 1446:     {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1447:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1448:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1449: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1450: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1451: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1452: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1453: 
 1454:     %% And runs some commands
 1455:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1456: 
 1457:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1458: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1459: 
 1460:     receive
 1461: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\r\n">>}} ->
 1462: 	    ok
 1463:     after 5000 ->
 1464: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1465:     end,
 1466: 
 1467:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
 1468: 
 1469: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1470: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi(Config) ->
 1471:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1472:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1473:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1474:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1475: 
 1476:     NumConcurent = 5,
 1477: 
 1478:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1479:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1480:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1481: 
 1482:     DaemonOpts = [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1483:                   {user_dir, UserDir},
 1484:                   {password, "morot"},
 1485:                   {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}],
 1486: 
 1487:     %% Servers tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1488:     Pids =
 1489:         [spawn_link(fun() ->
 1490:                             {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1491:                             {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, DaemonOpts)
 1492:                     end)
 1493:          || _ <- lists:seq(1,NumConcurent)],
 1494:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p daemons spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(Pids)]),
 1495: 
 1496:     %% The client accepts the tcp connections from the servers and ssh-connects to it
 1497:     ConnectionRefs =
 1498:         [begin
 1499:              {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1500:              {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1501:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1502:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1503:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1504:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1505:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1506:              ConnectionRef
 1507:          end || _Pid <- Pids],
 1508:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p connections accepted!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ConnectionRefs)]),
 1509: 
 1510:     %% And runs some exec commands
 1511:     Parent = self(),
 1512:     ClientPids =
 1513:         lists:map(
 1514:           fun(ConnectionRef) ->
 1515:                   spawn_link(
 1516:                     fun() ->
 1517:                             {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1518:                             success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "testing", infinity),
 1519:                             ct:log("~p:~p: exec on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef]),
 1520:                             receive
 1521:                                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\r\n">>}} ->
 1522:                                     Parent ! {answer_received,self()},
 1523:                                     ct:log("~p:~p: received result on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef])
 1524:                             after 5000 ->
 1525:                                     ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1526:                             end
 1527:                     end)
 1528:           end, ConnectionRefs),
 1529:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p clients spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ClientPids)]),
 1530: 
 1531:     lists:foreach(fun(P) ->
 1532:                           receive
 1533:                               {answer_received,P} -> ok
 1534:                           end
 1535:                   end, ClientPids),
 1536:     ct:log("~p:~p: All answers received!", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1537: 
 1538:     lists:foreach(fun ssh:close/1, ConnectionRefs).
 1539: 
 1540: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1541: gracefull_invalid_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1542:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1543:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1544:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1545:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1546:     
 1547:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1548:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1549:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1550: 
 1551:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1552:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["SSH-8.-1","\r\n"]),
 1553:     receive
 1554: 	Verstring ->
 1555: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1556: 	    receive
 1557: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1558: 		    ok
 1559: 	    end
 1560:     after 
 1561: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1562:     end.
