 1631: kex_error(Config) ->
 1632:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1633:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1634:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1635:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1636:     [Kex1,Kex2|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, ssh:default_algorithms()),
 1637:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1638:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1639:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1640:                                               {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex1]}]}
 1641:                                              ]),
 1642:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1643:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(kex_error,
 1644:                            fun(#{msg:={report,#{format:=Fmt,args:=As,label:={error_logger,_}}}}, Pid) ->
 1645:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1646:                                    Pid ! {Ref, lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,As))};
 1647:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1648:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1649:                                    ok % Other msg
 1650:                            end,
 1651:                            self()),
 1652:     try
 1653:         ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1654:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1655:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1656:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1657:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
 1658:                                           {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex2]}]}
 1659:                                          ])
 1660:     of
 1661:         _ ->
 1662:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1663:             ct:fail("expected failure", [])
 1664:     catch
 1665:         error:{badmatch,{error,"Key exchange failed"}} ->
 1666:             %% ok
 1667:             receive
 1668:                 {Ref, ErrMsgTxt} ->
 1669:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1670:                     ct:log("ErrMsgTxt = ~n~s", [ErrMsgTxt]),
 1671:                     Lines = lists:map(fun string:trim/1, string:tokens(ErrMsgTxt, "\n")),
 1672:                     OK = (lists:all(fun(S) -> lists:member(S,Lines) end,
 1673:                                     ["Disconnects with code = 3 [RFC4253 11.1]: Key exchange failed",
 1674:                                      "Details:",
 1675:                                      "No common key exchange algorithm,",
 1676:                                      "we have:",
 1677:                                      "peer have:"]) andalso
 1678:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex1)) =/= nomatch andalso
 1679:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex2)) =/= nomatch),
 1680:                     case OK of
 1681:                         true ->
 1682:                             ok;
 1683:                         false ->
 1684:                             ct:fail("unexpected error text msg", [])
 1685:                     end
 1686:             after 20000 ->
 1687:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1688:                     ct:fail("timeout", [])
 1689:             end;
 1690: 
 1691:         error:{badmatch,{error,_}} ->
 1692:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1693:             ct:fail("unexpected error msg", [])
 1694:     end.
 1695: 
 1696: stop_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1697:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1698:     %% to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1699:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1700:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1701:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1702: 
 1703:     {Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1704: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1705: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1706: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1707: 
 1708:     ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port,
 1709:                                           [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1710:                                            {user, "foo"},
 1711:                                            {password, "morot"},
 1712:                                            {user_interaction, false},
 1713:                                            {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1714:     {ok, ChannelId0} =
 1715:         ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef0, infinity),
 1716: 
 1717:     ssh:stop_listener(Host, Port),
 1718: 
 1719:     {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1720:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1721:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1722: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1723: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1724: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1725: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1726:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef0, ChannelId0,
 1727: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1728:     receive
 1729: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef0,
 1730:          {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1731: 	    ok;
 1732:     R -> ct:fail("Unexpected: ~p, Expected ~p",[R, <<"echo testing\n">>])
 1733: 
 1734:     after 5000 ->
 1735: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1736:     end,
 1737: 
 1738:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(Port, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1739:                                     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1740:                                     {password, "potatis"},
 1741:                                     {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]) of
 1742: 	{Pid1, Host, Port} ->
 1743: 	    ConnectionRef1 =
 1744:                 ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1745:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1746:                                                   {password, "potatis"},
 1747:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1748:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1749: 	    {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1750:                                                   {save_accepted_host, false},
 1751:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1752:                                                   {password, "morot"},
 1753:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1754:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1755: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1756: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef1),
 1757: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1758: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid1);
 1759: 	Error ->
 1760: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1761: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1762: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
 1763:     end.
 1764: 
 1765: no_sensitive_leak(Config) ->
 1766:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1767:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1768:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1769:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1770: 
 1771:     %% Save old, and set new log level:
 1772:     #{level := Level} = logger:get_primary_config(),
 1773:     logger:set_primary_config(level, info),
 1774:     %% Define a collect fun:
 1775:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1776:     Collect = 
 1777:         fun G(N,Nf,Nt) ->
 1778:                 receive
 1779:                     {Ref, false, _} ->
 1780:                         G(N+1, Nf+1, Nt);
 1781:                     {Ref, true, R} ->
 1782:                         ct:log("Report leaked:~n~p", [R]),
 1783:                         G(N+1, Nf, Nt+1)
 1784:                 after 100 ->
 1785:                         {N, Nf, Nt}
 1786:                 end
 1787:         end,
 1788:  
 1789:     %% Install the test handler:
 1790:     Hname = no_sensitive_leak,
 1791:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(Hname,
 1792:                            fun(#{msg := {report,#{report := Rep}}}, Pid) ->
 1793:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1794:                                    Pid ! {Ref,ssh_log_h:sensitive_in_opt(Rep),Rep};
 1795:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1796:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1797:                                    ok
 1798:                            end,
 1799:                            self()),
 1800: 
 1801:     {_Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1802: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1803: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1804: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1805: 
 1806:     _ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1807: 						       {user, "foo"},
 1808: 						       {password, "morot"},
 1809: 						       {user_interaction, true},
 1810: 						       {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1811:     %% Kill acceptor to make it restart:
 1812:     [true|_] =
 1813:         [exit(Pacc,kill) || {{ssh_system_sup,_},P1,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup),
 1814:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},P2,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P1),
 1815:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},Pacc,worker,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P2)],
 1816:     
 1817:     %% Remove the test handler and reset the logger level:
 1818:     timer:sleep(500),
 1819:     logger:remove_handler(Hname),
 1820:     logger:set_primary_config(Level),
 1821: 
 1822:     case Collect(0, 0, 0) of
 1823:         {0, 0,   0} -> ct:fail("Logging failed, line = ~p", [?LINE]);
 1824:         {_, _,   0} -> ok;
 1825:         {_, _, Nt0} -> ct:fail("Leak in ~p cases!", [Nt0])
 1826:     end.
 1827:     
 1828: start_subsystem_on_closed_channel(Config) ->
 1829:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1830:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1831:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1832:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1833:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1834: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1835: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1836: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}]),
 1837: 
 1838:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1839: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1840: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1841: 						      {user_interaction, false},
 1842: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1843: 
 1844: 
 1845:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1846:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1),
 1847:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, []),
 1848:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", 5000),
 1849:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1850:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1851: 
 1852:     %% Test that there could be a gap between close and an operation (Bugfix OTP-14939):
 1853:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1854:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2),
 1855:     timer:sleep(2000),
 1856:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, []),
 1857:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "echo_n", 5000),
 1858:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1859:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1860: 
 1861:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1862:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1863: 
 1864: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1865: max_channels_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1866:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1867:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1868:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1869:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1870:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1871: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1872: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1873: 					     {max_channels, 3},
 1874: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}
 1875: 					    ]),
 1876: 
 1877:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1878: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1879: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1880: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1881: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1882: 
 1883:     %% Allocate a number of ChannelId:s to play with. (This operation is not
 1884:     %% counted by the max_channel option).
 1885:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1886:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1887:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1888:     {ok, ChannelId3} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1889:     {ok, ChannelId4} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1890:     {ok, ChannelId5} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1891:     {ok, ChannelId6} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1892:     {ok, _ChannelId7} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1893: 
 1894:     %% Now start to open the channels (this is counted my max_channels) to check that
 1895:     %% it gives a failure at right place
 1896: 
 1897:     %%%---- Channel 1(3): shell
 1898:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId0),
 1899:     receive
 1900: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"Eshell",_/binary>>}} ->
 1901: 	    ok
 1902:     after 5000 ->
 1903: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1904:     end,
 1905: 
 1906:     %%%---- Channel 2(3): subsystem "echo_n"
 1907:     success = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", infinity),
 1908: 
 1909:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): exec. This closes itself.
 1910:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", infinity),
 1911:     receive
 1912: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId2, 0, <<"testing1",_/binary>>}} ->
 1913: 	    ok
 1914:     after 5000 ->
 1915: 	    ct:fail("Exec #1 Timeout")
 1916:     end,
 1917: 
 1918:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): subsystem "echo_n" (Note that ChannelId2 should be closed now)
 1919:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId3, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1920: 
 1921:     %%%---- Channel 4(3) !: exec  This should fail
 1922:     failure = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId4, "testing2.\n", infinity),
 1923: 
 1924:     %%%---- close the shell (Frees one channel)
 1925:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1926:     
 1927:     %%%---- wait for the subsystem to terminate
 1928:     receive
 1929: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef,{closed,ChannelId0}} -> ok
 1930:     after 5000 ->
 1931: 	    ct:log("Timeout waiting for '{ssh_cm,~p,{closed,~p}}'~n"
 1932: 		   "Message queue:~n~p",
 1933: 		   [ConnectionRef,ChannelId0,erlang:process_info(self(),messages)]),
 1934: 	    ct:fail("exit Timeout",[])
 1935:     end,
 1936: 
 1937:     %%---- Try that we can open one channel instead of the closed one
 1938:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId5, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1939: 
 1940:     %%---- But not a fourth one...
 1941:     failure = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId6, "echo_n", infinity),
 1942: 
 1943:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1944:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1945: 
 1946: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1947: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 1948: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1949: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef) ->
 1950:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 1).
 1951: 
 1952: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, N) ->
 1953:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1954:     Cmd = "yes testing | head -n " ++ integer_to_list(N),
 1955:     ct:log("Cmd to be invoked over SSH shell: ~p", [Cmd]),
 1956:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Cmd, infinity),
 1957:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\r\n">>,
 1958:     case N of
 1959:         1 ->
 1960:             %% receive response to input
 1961:             receive
 1962:                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, ExpectedBin}} ->
 1963:                     ok;
 1964:                 R -> ct:fail("Unexpected reply: ~p, Expected: ~p",[R, ExpectedBin])
 1965:             after
 1966:                 10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1967:             end;
 1968:         _ ->
 1969:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1970:     end,
 1971: 
 1972:     %% receive close messages
 1973:     receive
 1974: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
 1975: 	    ok
 1976:     after
 1977: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1978:     end,
 1979:     receive
 1980: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
 1981: 	    ok
 1982:     after
 1983: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1984:     end,
 1985:     receive
 1986: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
 1987: 	    ok
 1988:     after
 1989: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1990:     end.
 1991: 
 1992: 
 1993: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1994: flush_msgs() ->
 1995:     flush_msgs([]).
 1996: 
 1997: flush_msgs(Unexpected) ->
 1998:     receive
 1999:         M ->
 2000:             case lists:member(M, Unexpected) of
 2001:                 true ->
 2002:                     ct:fail("Unexpected message found:  ~p", [M]);
 2003:                 _ ->
 2004:                     flush_msgs()
 2005:             end
 2006:     after
 2007:         500 -> ok
 2008:     end.
 2009: 
 2010: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2011: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2012:     test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Prohibited.">>, <<"Eshell V">>).
 2013: 
 2014: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, NotExpect) ->
 2015:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2016:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef, ChannelId),
 2017:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 2018:     NotExpSz = size(NotExpect),
 2019:     receive
 2020:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 1, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 2021:             flush_msgs();
 2022: 
 2023:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<NotExpect:NotExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 2024:             ct:fail("Could start disabled shell!");
 2025: 
 2026:         R ->
 2027:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2028:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, '0|1', Expect}} ]),
 2029:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 2030: 
 2031:     after 5000 ->
 2032:             ct:fail("Shell Timeout")
 2033:     end.
 2034: 
 2035: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2036: test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2037:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2038:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "1+2.", infinity),
 2039:     receive
 2040:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ->
 2041:             flush_msgs();
 2042:         R ->
 2043:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2044:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ]),
 2045:             ct:fail("Could exec erlang term although non-erlang shell")
 2046:     after 5000 ->
 2047:             ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 2048:     end.
 2049: 
 2050: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2051: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2052:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Eshell V">>).
 2053: 
 2054: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect) ->
 2055:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, []).
 2056: 
 2057: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, PtyOpts) ->
 2058:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2059:     case PtyOpts of
 2060:         [] ->
 2061:             no_alloc;
 2062:         _ ->
 2063:             success = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, PtyOpts)
 2064:     end,
 2065:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
 2066: 
 2067:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 2068:     receive
 2069: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 2070: 	    flush_msgs();
 2071: 
 2072:         R ->
 2073:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2074:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ]),
 2075:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 2076: 
 2077:     after 5000 ->
 2078: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 2079:     end.
 2080: 
 2081: 
 2082: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2083:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, "1+2.", <<"3">>).
 2084: 
 2085: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Exec, Expect) ->
 2086:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2087:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Exec, infinity),
 2088:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 2089:     receive
 2090:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0,
 2091:                                  <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} = R ->
 2092:             ct:log("~p:~p Got expected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,R]);
 2093:         Other ->
 2094:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2095:                    [?MODULE,?LINE, Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 2096:                                            {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}}]),
 2097:             {fail, "Unexpected data"}
 2098:     after 5000 ->
 2099:             {fail,"Exec Timeout"}
 2100:     end.
 2101: 
 2102: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 2103: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId) ->
 2104:     big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []).
 2105: 
 2106: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Acc) ->
 2107:     receive
 2108: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} ->
 2109: 	    big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, [Data | Acc]);
 2110: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
 2111: 	    {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))}
 2112:     after ?EXEC_TIMEOUT ->
 2113: 	    timeout
 2114:     end.
 2115: 
 2116: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize) ->
 2117:     ct:log("~p:~p Listener ~p running! ConnectionRef=~p, ChannelId=~p",
 2118:            [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),ConnectionRef,ChannelId]),
 2119:     collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [], 0).
 2120: 
 2121: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum) ->
 2122:     TO = 5000,
 2123:     receive
 2124: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} when is_binary(Data) ->
 2125: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p bytes. total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 2126: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,size(Data),Sum+size(Data),EchoSize-Sum]),
 2127: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [Data | Acc], Sum+size(Data));
 2128: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={eof, ChannelId}} ->
 2129: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 2130: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={closed,ChannelId}} ->
 2131: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 2132: 	Msg ->
 2133: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ***** unexpected message *****~n~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 2134: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 2135:     after TO ->
 2136: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ----- Nothing received for ~p seconds -----~n",[?MODULE,?LINE,TO]),
 2137: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 2138:     end.
 2139: 
 2140: collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize) ->
 2141:     try
 2142: 	iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))
 2143:     of
 2144: 	Bin ->
 2145: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nGot in total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 2146: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,size(Bin),EchoSize,size(Bin)]),
 2147: 	    Bin
 2148:     catch
 2149: 	C:E ->
 2150: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nAcc is strange...~nException=~p:~p~nAcc=~p",
 2151: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,C,E,Acc]),
 2152: 	    {error,{C,E}}
 2153:     end.
 2154: 
 2155: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
 2156: %% This is taken from the ssh example code.
 2157: start_our_shell(_User, _Peer) ->
 2158:     spawn(fun() ->
 2159: 		  io:format("Enter command\n")
 2160: 		  %% Don't actually loop, just exit
 2161:           end).
 2162: 
 2163: start_our_shell2(_User, _Peer) ->
 2164:     spawn(fun() ->
 2165:                   io:format("Enter command\n"),
 2166:                   read_write_loop1("> ", 1)
 2167:           end).
 2168: 
 2169: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd) ->
 2170:     spawn(fun() ->
 2171:                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 2172:           end).
 2173: 
 2174: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd, User) ->
 2175:     spawn(fun() ->
 2176:                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 2177:           end).
 2178: 
 2179: receive_bytes(_, _, 0, _) ->
 2180:     ct:log("ALL DATA RECEIVED Budget = 0"),
 2181:     ct:log("================================ ExpectBudget = 0 (reception completed)"),
 2182:     ok;
 2183: receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Budget, AccSize) when Budget > 0 ->
 2184:     receive
 2185:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, D}} ->
 2186:             Fmt = "================================ ExpectBudget = "
 2187:                 "~p bytes Received/Total = ~p/~p bytes",
 2188:             Args = [Budget, byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D)],
 2189:             ct:log(Fmt, Args),
 2190:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 2191:                           Budget - byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D))
 2192:     after
 2193:         10000 ->
 2194:             ct:log("process_info(self(), messages) = ~p",
 2195:                    [process_info(self(), messages)]),
 2196:             ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2197:     end.
